intro: Wedelia eggersii, commonly known as the Orange Sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or herb, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Its showy inflorescences make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in warm climates.
